intro: Trigonotis radicans, commonly known as the creeping trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are opposite along the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Trigonotis radicans is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to form dense ground covers.
